Reviews.Title: “Berlin weekend”
Reviews.Author: RushdenEug
Reviews.Content: This is a reasonably priced hotel situated in East Berlin,good hot shower, clean and comfortable good sized rooms if a little dated,helpful and efficient staff at check in and out.Decent buffet style breakfast with good choice of fresh fruit, cereals, bacon and egg etc. This hotel was fine for a short break, however something which may bother some is the distance from the Alexandreplatz, it was no problem to us, we actually enjoyed the ride into the city on the tram. The hotel is a 20 minute tram ride from the city centre, the number M6 tram stop is a couple of hundred yards from the hotel and trams run on time every 10 minutes. We purchased Berlin Welcome Cards at the airport which give you unlimited travel on the city's public transport network and also discounts at several city attractions and tours. We would certainly consider this hotel the next time we visit Berlin

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Value for Money, Great Breakfast, comfy bed...a perfect 3 star hotel!”
Reviews.Author: EmilyandMattLondon
Reviews.Content: We went to Berlin on a flight and hotel deal for late November...and we're glad we picked this hotel! 2 minutes away from the tram stop, and take the No.7 tram to Alexanderplatz in 20 minutes, cant ask for better for the money. Its in 'proper' East Berlin, it truly is a suburb, and the decor is a little dated (but you dont go to Berlin sit in a hotel room!). Couldnt really fault the room generally-the showers were strong and warm, and the beds were comfortable, and the room was a nice warm temperature for the Berlin winter! Breakfast was amazing, featuring pretty much anything you could think of...bacon and scrambled egg, croissants, cheese, cold meat, toast, cereal, fresh fruit, yoghurt, juice...nice and filling for the long and busy Berlin days. Service in the hotel was good too, they let us have breakfast early on our last day when we needed to catch our flight. As a tip for those of you who are only there for two or three days-insider tours were really good!

Reviews.Title: “A Really Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: GyroscopeUK
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a week in August 2011 and really enjoyed our stay here. Check in was quick and simple and we were soon in our good sized room. Our Twin Bed room also contained a desk, table, two chairs, clothes hanging space with about 8 hangers, shelves, TV and various lamps. The bathroom was also a good size and contained a bath and very good shower. The only problem with the bathroom was the draining from the sink was very slow and also there was no working extractor. The breakfast buffet was also really pleasing and was constantly restocked each day. There was a choice of sausages, streaky bacon, scrambled and hard boiled eggs and a range of cold meats and cheeses. There was also a good selection of breads with a toaster available and also about 10 different types of jams and spreads. There was also cereal, fresh fruit and yoghurt. We were also impressed at the range of drinks available - a selection of teas and coffee. The staff were helpful and polite and also dealt with other requests well, such as a need for 'hot chocolate milk' from the table next to us! Reception staff were approachable and helpful and ordered a taxi for us when leaving which arrived within 10 minutes. WiFi is available through the hotel, but is quite pricey. However if you use the WiFi in the lobby it is free! Lots of people taking advantage of this and sitting downstairs each evening in the lobby with their laptops and iPads. There is a bowling alley downstairs and the restaurant by this does simple snacks. The pizzas we had were really tasty. The location is less than a five minute walk from the nearest tram stop, and the M6 tram only takes about 20 minutes to reach Alexanderplatz. Trams ran every 10 mins throughout the day, and also less frequently throughout the night too. We always managed to get a seat. We were very pleased with this hotel and would definitely stay here again if visiting Berlin another time.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jrussellpowell
Reviews.Content: Stayed on a weekend trip to Berlin and was satisfied; not blown away, but very satisfied for a budget hotel. The quality of the hotel is OK. It is really a budget hotel. The room clean, furnished well enough and the bed was not uncomfortable. I would have probably grown a little exhausted with it on a stay of a week or more, but this would be true for any budget hotel and for two nights, it was very good for a night’s rest after sightseeing. The staff, again, was OK. Not overfriendly or helpful, but not rude or inattentive either. The breakfast was included in our rate which, as you guessed, was OK. Nothing spectacular and it is certainly not going to win any critic awards. But the food was fine and I didn’t walk away hungry either. The location is fine. Not very close to the center, but there is a tram stop about 5 minutes away which will take you to Alexanderplatz in about 20 minutes. Obviously, there are going to be nicer and more conveniently located hotels in Berlin. But, for the price, this is a good option. If do not crave luxury and are just looking for a clean hotel that will allow you to see the city without breaking the bank, this might be a very good fit. Would probably book again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, roomy, clean and the bowling alley is fun!”
Reviews.Author: vazmann2
Reviews.Content: On the "east" side about 7-8 km from stadtmitte, but close to strassebahn stop. Ample free parking for drivers. Great value, roomy, clean, quiet and the bowling alley is fun! Great breakfast included, and the staff is helpful if not overly hospitable. Avoid the 5 Euro charge (30 mins.) for use of a computer and the laundry service which was pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: PanZafir
Reviews.Content: We made this reservation for less than 30 € / night!! The hotel is on the east side of Berlin in an old residential building, which was revamped to become a hotel. This is evident from the huge rooms and big windows. The room and bathroom were spotless, comfortable and the only negative point is that it seemed old-fashioned, almost '80s. The staff was polite, smiling and helpful. The breakfast was rich and had great variety. The city center was reachable with a tram that takes you in approximately 25 minutes to Alexander Platz. The stop was at 200 m. For so little money, this hotel was a wonderful choice, but also an opportunity to see better the east, not touristic, part of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Good Find”
Reviews.Author: rbsimmo
Reviews.Content: We stayed from 07/06/10 - 10/06/10 Hotel is easy to find. Looks a little derelict on the outside and you see signs on the hotel for a bowling alley which throws you a bit but when we walked inside we were pleasantly surprised. We couldn’t get any other accommodation at short notice as there was an international convention on in Berlin and most hotels were booked out. We were in room 5.3 on the 5th floor. Rooms are a little outdated, but very clean, large inside with a foyer that has a wardrobe and places to hang your jackets and then a separate door into your bedroom which had a table and chairs for 2 people a writing desk a TV with one English speaking channel BBC and a very comfy bed which we both slept well in. Breakfast is included each morning and consisted of scrambled eggs, boiled eggs bacon, breads, pastries, cereals, yoghurt, cold meats, fresh fruit salad, tea, coffee and juices. A very good selection. Parking is also free for your car on the property. The hotel is situated a 3 minute walk to the tram station. Tickets for the tram can be bought at reception. €2.10 one way or a full day tram pass for €6.10. All you need to do is catch the M6 tram in and back it is that simple and takes about 10 minutes on the tram to reach Alexander Platz stop. The hotel is a 3 star which could do with a furniture update but we were comfortable and had plenty of room to strtch out. The hotel is very fresh smelling and the housekeeping is very good, no complaints from us. The only real negative is that the rooms do not have air conditioning so you have to leave your window open, but being on a main road produced some noise from traffic. I would recommend this hotel as it was a lot cheaper than hotels in the heart of Berlin and you can get a great price online.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel, but a little far from downtown Berlin”
Reviews.Author: gcjones
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 2 nights (Jun 16-17, 2010) as part of a tour group. The rooms were comfortable and clean. The property, located in former East Berlin, is about a 20 minute tram ride from Alexanderplatz. The tram stop is right across the street from the hotel. The breakfast was good and plentiful. There is a small bar and an 8 lane bowling alley in the hotel. If you're looking for an inexpensive place to stay, and don't mind a commute to downtown Berlin while visiting, this may be an option to consider.

Reviews.Title: “Consideration for disabled travellers”
Reviews.Author: caseyfanne
Reviews.Content: I travelled with my husband and 17 year old daughter, who will be doing her final exam in German next year, to Berlin for one week. I felt by going to Berlin, it would make the language fmore interesting for her. I have a disability, with limited mobility. I had to bring my 'battery scooter' to Germany with me. The Hotel did not have a vacant 'disabled room' the first night, but did for the other 6 nights, so we stayed in a 3- bedroomed room first night. For the other 6 nights, they kindly gave us the 'disabled room' and left us keep 3-bedroomed room. Disabled room very accessible. The rooms were big and beautiful. A lovely big breakfast every morning. We looked for an Iron and Kettle and were given them without any charge. Anne. Rep. Ireland

Reviews.Title: “Very recommended hotel, a little bit far from center”
Reviews.Author: Segmany
Reviews.Content: It was the first time I've been in Berlin and I ordered a single room on this hotel after checking the net. I really scared that the hotel will be far and look bad, because it was very cheep but It was exactly as I hoped it will be. The hotel is great. I got a very nice room, including bed, TV and a bathroom. I've got the highest floor and got a great view from there over the east side of Berlin. The hotel is located about 25 minutes by TRAM (M6) from Alexanderplatz. First, It looked to me very far, but accually it's a very good place and it is very easy to get from it to anywhere. There's another TRAM to get easy to and from Schonfeld airport. They have a great service and it is acually one hotel on a net of hotels. The breakfast was also very good with buffet. If I ever be in Berlin again I guess I'll go there again.

Reviews.Title: “OK Budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: lbh3
Reviews.Content: Comfort Inn Berlin Lichtenberg is an OK hotel for the budget traveller. The rooms are small and with a bed, chair and TV. Front desk is helpful and breakfast is a nice buffet with plenty of items. Beware - the hotel is located in a suburb about 20 min tramdrive from Alexander Platz, but with tram M6 and a "Go as you please" card. 20 Euro for 72 hours that isn't a problem. There is no Imbiss-stube, no restaurant or anything else near the hotel, so you have to depend on the hotel or the tram. We had fun playing bowling, with is in the hotel building.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but not the best location”
Reviews.Author: vegiemite6
Reviews.Content: This hotel was nice, great breakfast and the room and bathroom was clean and comfortable. The only downside is it is about a 20 minute tram ride into the city centre (Alexanderplatz). For the price though it was great, and the tram ride wasn't really a problem it just meant we weren't able to pop back to the hotel to freshen up before dinner. We caught the tram back at night and felt safe enough, just pay attention as it is hard to see at night where the stop for the hotel is.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: very nice hotel maid service is excellent. hotel reception very good.Trams just a stones throw from the hotel which are excellent value for money. We decided to stay in hotel bar for the night Big Mistake it was over run with kids playing bowling unfortunately the bar was in the bowling alley spoilt a good holiday.

Reviews.Title: “very Nice place”
Reviews.Author: Vianjando100pre
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in March of 2005 with a group. The place was nice, they had a bowling alley and a bar which was very convinient when you just wanted to chill and not have to go out. i didnt deal too much with the staff but they seemed nice, the place was clean and they left little candies on our pillows everyday, i would definately stay here again if i ever went back to Berlin.

HotelInfo.Name: Comfort Hotel Lichtenberg
HotelInfo.Address: Rhinstrasse 159, 10315 Berlin, Germany
